title: Smoked Tilapia Sandwich
summary: Smoked Tilapia Sandwich is a pescatarian recipe with 15 servings. One portion of this dish contains roughly 4g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 47 calories. For 36 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of garlic aioli, tilapia fillets, paprika, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 33%. This score is rather bad. Try Tilapia Sandwich, Blackened Tilapia Sandwich, and Pan Fried Tilapia Sandwich for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapia can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Thrive Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

instructions: Heat broiler.                                            Place fish on rack of broiling pan sprayed with cooking spray; sprinkle with paprika.                                              Broil, 4 inches from heat, 5 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork. Meanwhile, combine next 3 ingredients.                                            Place fish on bottom halves of rolls; cover with Singles, pickle mixture and tops of rolls.

steps.step: Place fish on rack of broiling pan sprayed with cooking spray; sprinkle with paprika.
Broil, 4 inches from heat, 5 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork. Meanwhile, combine next 3 ingredients.
Place fish on bottom halves of rolls; cover with Singles, pickle mixture and tops of rolls.
